text: He who fears he shall suffer, already suffers what he fears.
author: Michel de Montaigne

text: You'll worry less about what people think about you when you realize how seldom they do.
author: David Foster Wallace

text: Life shrinks or expands in proportion to one's courage.
author: Anaïs Nin

text: One must choose in life between boredom and suffering.
author: Madame de Staël

text: All sins are attempts to fill voids.
author: Simone Weil

text: The curious paradox is that when I accept myself just as I am, then I can change.
author: Carl Rogers

text: Genius is nothing more than childhood recaptured at will.
author: Charles Baudelaire

text: Learning more is a smart person's favorite form of procrastination.
author: Mark Manson

text: The most common way people give up their power is by thinking they don't have any.
author: Alice Walker
